thread_title: EKX-1 Extraction: Session 02 - Boilerplate Rejection, Figma Discovery, and Build Factory Strategy

1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: Continuation from morning session (system housekeeping, fitness app, 200k token context review).
Session ran across two Claude Code conversations due to context limits.

Part 1: Claude built 11 generic React components and 8 demo pages for Enterprise OS hub app, which were harshly rejected by user John as 'AI-looking shite' not matching the intended workflow of converting real Figma templates.
Part 2: Course correction - examined actual Brainwave 2.0 Figma PNG exports to understand real design, extracted design tokens, and began rewriting components.

Part 3: Discovered the real bottleneck: no Figma-to-React tool allows batch URL conversion; all require manual plugin use per frame. Used Figma API to extract direct links to all 73 frames across 20 pages in the Brainwave file.

Part 4: Strategic planning for building a full component library, cataloging 77 page types and 96 component types, selecting Anima as the conversion tool (200 conversions/month), and planning a conversion budget.
Part 5: Batch export script `batch-export-all-kits.js` running, 8 of 38 kits completed, ~15 hours remaining.

Part 6: John's realization that the old approach of months of hand-building and expanding documentation was a 'mirage' and untenable due to token costs. Shift to new approach: Build a component library + token system + boilerplate assembly factory for rapid platform assembly.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: Convert actual Brainwave 2.0 Figma template screens into React components (correcting initial misunderstanding).
Establish a viable Figma-to-React conversion workflow.
Build a comprehensive, reusable component library (the 'Build Factory').
Enable rapid assembly of multiple platforms (Enterprise OS, Fitness, Property, LeadEngine) from shared parts.
Reduce development time from months to days per platform.
Get the build factory capabilities operational this week.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: Components match the exact design of the hi-fidelity Figma templates, not generic AI-looking UI.
A working process to convert Figma frames to React code is established and documented.
A complete P0+P1 component library is built, tokenized, and ready for use.
Platforms can be assembled rapidly (in days) from the library.
Token cost of context loading is reduced from the untenable 200k experienced.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: REJECT generic, invented boilerplate components. Must convert real Figma designs.
Selected Anima as the Figma-to-React conversion tool (best value: 200 conversions/month).
Convert component library pages FIRST (e.g., Buttons, Inputs pages) before full screens for efficiency (one conversion yields many components).
Focus on 5-10 key pages per priority kit, ignore the other 100+ less critical pages.
The complete component library (Build Factory) is now the top priority, not any single platform like LeadEngine.
Brand tokens (e.g., Enterprise=#0B8C00) will be swapped per platform.
Corrected kit mapping: Fitness kit is 'Befit', not 'Fitness Pro'.

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: UI Assembly Pipeline: Must start from actual Figma designs, not invent components.
Figma Conversion Workflow: Open Figma file -> select frame -> run Anima plugin -> copy generated React code -> repeat per frame. (No batch URL mode exists).
Library Build Order: 1. Convert component pages. 2. Convert key screens. 3. Decompose & tokenize output into library components.
Session Onboarding: Need to standardize what documentation gets read at session start to reduce context loading cost.

6_scripts.title: Scripts / Commands
items: `batch-export-all-kits.js` - Script running to export all 38 kit designs. Progress tracked in `figma-exports/batch_progress.json`.

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Inputs: Brainwave 2.0 Figma file (ID: 6hCuwRI0GsBmIOJelAVpND), PNG screenshot exports of Brainwave screens, List of 38 component kit Figma files.

Outputs (Created/Modified): `globals.css` (rewritten with Brainwave tokens), `AppShell.tsx` (rewritten to match Brainwave sidebar/topbar), `AuthSplit.tsx` (partially rewritten), 8 generic boilerplate components (REJECTED), 8 demo pages (REJECTED), `BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md`, `kit_roles.md` (updated), `MEMORY.md` (updated).

Outputs (Discovered/Generated): Direct Figma links for all 73 frames across 20 pages in the Brainwave file. Catalog of 77 page types (P0/P1/P2). Catalog of 96 component types (P0/P1/P2). Analysis table of Figma-to-React tools (Locofy, Builder.io, Anima, Codia AI, Figma Make).

8_missteps.title: Missteps / Errors / Risks
items: Major Misstep: Built 11 generic, 'AI-looking' React components from scratch instead of converting the actual Brainwave Figma templates, leading to user rejection and wasted time.
Risk: Relying on ever-expanding, unstructured documentation that is not in a database, making context retrieval for LLMs token-prohibitive and untenable.
Risk: Manual, per-frame Figma conversion process is time-consuming; no batch automation exists.
Risk: Potential cost of conversion tools (e.g., Locofy Lightning deemed too expensive with annual billing).

9_blockers.title: Blockers
items: No Figma-to-React tool allows batch processing via URLs; every tool requires manual, frame-by-frame plugin interaction within Figma.
High token cost (~200k) for loading session context is unsustainable.
Documentation and processes are scattered, not in a queryable database, hindering systematic reuse and context building.

10_status.title: Status
items: Batch kit export: In Progress (8 of 38 kits completed, ~15 hours remaining).
Build Factory / Component Library: Planning and tool selection complete (Anima). Conversion not yet started.
Brainwave component updates: Partially complete (globals.css, AppShell.tsx updated; AuthSplit.tsx incomplete).
Overall session work: Ended in strategic planning phase, ready to execute conversion tomorrow.

11_progress.title: Progress Markers
items: Identified and corrected fundamental workflow error (building vs. converting).
Extracted all direct Figma links for Brainwave screens and components.
Selected a viable conversion tool (Anima).
Defined a conversion budget and library build strategy.
Updated core design tokens and AppShell to match real Brainwave design.
Batch export script initiated and progressing.

12_refinements.title: Refinements
items: Workflow refined from 'build generic components' to 'convert exact Figma designs'.
Strategy refined from 'build LeadEngine first' to 'build the component library factory first'.
Tool selection refined after evaluating 5 options; chose Anima for best value.
Kit mapping refined: Corrected 'Fitness Pro' to 'Befit'.
Documentation (`BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md`, `MEMORY.md`) updated to lock in the corrected process.

13_dependencies.title: Dependencies
items: Completion of the `batch-export-all-kits.js` script for all 38 kits.
Access to Anima plugin (200 monthly conversions).
Granular PRDs being ready for cross-reference against kit inventories.
Database system to store components, tokens, and processes (to be designed in PRD MK11).

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: Brainwave 2.0: The primary Figma design system/kit being converted first.
Kits: 38 total component kits (e.g., Real Estate SaaS Kit, Huose Property, Social Dashboards, Befit, Fleet Travel, etc.).
Tools: Anima (selected converter), Locofy Lightning, Builder.io Visual Copilot, Codia AI, Figma Make (evaluated).
Platforms: Enterprise OS, Fitness App (Befit), Property Platform, LeadEngine (target outputs of the Build Factory).
Files: `BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md` (master process), `kit_roles.md` (kit mapping), `MEMORY.md` (session memory), `batch_progress.json` (export tracker).

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: P0: Priority level - pages/components needed on every platform (11 pages, ~23 components).
P1: Priority level - pages/components needed on most platforms (10 pages, ~13 components).
P2: Priority level - pages/components that can wait (56 pages, ~15+ specialist components).
Build Factory: The system comprising the reusable component library, token system, and assembly boilerplates.
UI Assembly Pipeline: The defined workflow for converting Figma designs to assembled React applications.
Tokens: Design tokens (colors, typography) that are swapped per platform for branding.

16_future.title: Future
items: Tomorrow (2026-02-17) Morning: Check batch export completion, review PRD status, cross-reference with kits.
Tomorrow Main Work: Build localhost thumbnail browser for visual selection, start Anima conversions on Brainwave component pages, decompose/tokenize output, design database in PRD MK11.
Side Quest: Standardize session onboarding practices, reduce token cost of context loading, move things into a database, ingest scattered bucket folders as archives.
This Week's Goal: 12-14 hour days to get Build Factory operational, build fitness app, get enterprise platform screens working, reach rapid assembly capability.

17_pending.title: Pending
items: Completion of `batch-export-all-kits.js` (30 kits remaining).
Finishing `AuthSplit.tsx` conversion (interrupted, to be done via Anima).
Conversion of any React components from actual Figma designs (not started).
Building the complete P0+P1 component library.
Creation of the database system for storing components and processes.
Reduction of context loading token cost.

18_questions.title: Open Questions
items: Are the granular PRDs ready for cross-referencing?
What are the exact 5-10 key pages to convert for each priority kit?
How will the database design (PRD MK11) precisely function for platform-wide features (saves, likes, auth)?
What is the optimal, low-token method for session onboarding and context loading?

19_meta.title: Meta-Observations
items: Pattern: Initial AI tendency to invent/generate can conflict with user requirement for exact replication from a source (Figma).
Insight: The value shifts from building individual platforms to building the capability to build *any* platform (the factory).
Insight: Manual, repetitive tasks (frame-by-frame conversion) are a major bottleneck even with AI assistance; tool limitations dictate workflow.
Insight: Unstructured, expanding documentation becomes a liability for AI context; a structured, database-backed system is needed for scalability.

20_assets.title: Reusable Assets
items: `BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md` - Locked-in pipeline process document.
Figma Frame Links - Direct URLs to all 73 frames in the Brainwave 2.0 file for easy access.
Page & Component Catalogs - Lists of 77 page types and 96 component types with priority levels (P0/P1/P2).
Tool Evaluation Matrix - Comparison of Figma-to-React conversion tools (Fidelity, Free Tier, Price, Notes).
Design Tokens - Extracted Brainwave color palette (#FCFCFC to #121212, accents) and Inter typography scale.
Kit Mapping (`kit_roles.md`) - Corrected mapping of kit names to their roles (e.g., Fitness Pro -> Befit).

summary: Session 02 involved a critical course correction after the user rejected AI-generated boilerplate components, reinforcing the mandate to convert exact Figma designs. The session uncovered the manual bottleneck of Figma-to-React tools, selected Anima as the converter, and pivoted strategy to prioritize building a comprehensive, reusable component library ('Build Factory') over building any single platform. A batch export of 38 kits is in progress, and plans were made for intensive conversion work to enable rapid platform assembly.
